result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rudy A Leffelman

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rudy A Leffelman in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Rudy A Leffelman. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Upon motion of the State case is granted to be dismissed and read-in.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM (64-05) Defendant Rudy A Leffelman appeared by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Rudy A Leffelman.  Attorney Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  
Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
DDA Sempf states the Information is in his file.
Attorney Uzowulu accepts that representation and will plea not guilty on behalf of his client.
Reserved speedy.

Adj. 2:07PM
Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
BOND TO COVER 22CF251 & 21CF453

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rudy A Leffelman in court, in custody by video. Attorney Uzowulu appeared. Defendant does qualify for SPD. State asking for cash. Rights given and hearing requested, within time limit for preliminary hearing. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
